[[Image:Sea-ward Tower.jpg|The Sea-ward Tower as portrayed in ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]''|frame]]
The '''Sea-ward Tower''' or '''Seaward Tower'''<ref name=poem>{{ATB|6}}</ref>, also called '''Tirith Aear''', was a tower situated in or near [[Dol Amroth]].<ref name=preface>{{ATB|Preface}}</ref>

In a poem recorded in the [[Red Book of Westmarch]],<ref name=preface/> a single "slow bell" that was "high in the Seaward Tower" rang solemnly at an "unseemly hour" to announce "the news of" the [[Man in the Moon]]'s "[[moon]]sick cruise" aboard "a fisherman's boat" in the [[Bay of Belfalas]].<ref name=poem/>

== Etymology ==
''Tirith Aear'' is a [[Sindarin]] name possibly meaning "sea watch". It consists of the word ''[[tirith]]'' ("watching, guarding;<ref>{{VT|42a}}, p. 11</ref> watch, ward, guard")<ref>{{PE|17}}, pp. 25, 31</ref> and ''[[aear]]'' ("sea")<ref>{{RGEO|Notes}}, p. 65</ref>.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-530255251.html|articlename=S. Tirith Aear ''loc''.|dated=|website=eldamo|accessed=}}</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
{{Rewrite}}
In the first version of ''[[The Man in the Moon Came Down Too Soon]]'', The Man in the Moon's arrival in Norwich town was announced by "the city's '''fifty towers'''", referring to the many churches in the city.<ref name=earlyversion>{{ATB|Comm}}</ref> This was changed in the "second professional typescript" to "the city's '''ringing towers'''".<ref>{{LT1|Why}}, pp. 204-6</ref>. These "ringing towers" are identified by [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] as [[Wikipedia:St Peter Mancroft|St Peter Mancroft]], a parish church in the center of Norwich. In a subsequent typescript, Tolkien changed the line to "in tall '''St. Peter’s tower'''". In [[1961]], Tolkien changed the line to "high in the Seaward Tower" and wrote the names Tirith Aear and the Sea-ward Tower in the preface.<ref name=collectedpoems>{{CP|24}}, pp. 131-47</ref>

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''1996: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
:The Tirith Aear is conceived to have been constructed as a refuge for the [[Elves]] of [[Edhellond]] by the [[Sindar|Sinda]] [[King of Lórien|lord]] [[Amroth]], between {{SA|1600}} and [[Second Age|S.A. 1620]]. It is also said to have been used by Galadriel, who installed "a huge bronze bell in its highest chamber" in {{TA|1}}. A full layout of the tower is provided.<ref>{{ICE|2021}}</ref>
